intro: Thesium densiflorum, commonly known as the denseflower thesium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, including South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which is commonly referred to as the goldenclub family. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, often in well-drained soils. Thesium densiflorum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
